channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: What to know about Admiral Bradley, who oversaw controversial boat strikes
item.description: As Congress raises questions about the legality of U.S. military boat strikes in the Caribbean, the spotlight is falling on Admiral Mitch Bradley, the commander of U.S. Special Operations Command.
item.content:encoded: As Congress raises questions about the legality of U.S. military boat strikes in the Caribbean, the spotlight is falling on Admiral Mitch Bradley, the commander of U.S. Special Operations Command.
item.dc:creator: Saige Miller

item.title: The immigration crackdown in Charlotte seems to be over, but the community is struggling
item.description: The Border Patrol's aggressive immigration operation in Charlotte, N.C., took the city by surprise. It lasted about a week, but immigrants and other residents say their city won't ever be the same.
item.content:encoded: The Border Patrol's aggressive immigration operation in Charlotte, N.C., took the city by surprise. It lasted about a week, but immigrants and other residents say their city won't ever be the same.
item.dc:creator: Adrian Florido

item.title: Appeals court hands Trump a victory, OK'ing firings of two independent agency heads
item.description: The D.C. Circuit Court of Appeals ruled 2 to 1 that President Trump's firings of Democratic members of the Merit Systems Protection Board and the National Labor Relations Board were lawful.
item.content:encoded: The D.C. Circuit Court of Appeals ruled 2 to 1 that President Trump's firings of Democratic members of the Merit Systems Protection Board and the National Labor Relations Board were lawful.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Trump's security strategy slams European allies and asserts U.S. power in the Americas
item.description: The Trump administration has set forth a national security strategy that paints European allies as weak and aims to reassert America's dominance in the Western Hemisphere.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration has set forth a national security strategy that paints European allies as weak and aims to reassert America's dominance in the Western Hemisphere.

(Image credit: Julia Demaree Nikhinson)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Who is the Jan. 6 pipe bomb suspect? And, lawmakers see video of deadly boat strike
item.description: After a years-long investigation, the FBI has arrested a man accused of planting the Jan. 6 pipe bombs. And, lawmakers yesterday saw video of a deadly strike on an alleged drug boat in the Caribbean.
item.content:encoded:
After a years-long investigation, the FBI has arrested a man accused of planting the Jan. 6 pipe bombs. And, lawmakers yesterday saw video of a deadly strike on an alleged drug boat in the Caribbean.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Who sued Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth this week? Find out in the quiz
item.description: This week, you'll need to be knowledgeable about holy media darlings, portrait-making techniques, and beloved Canadian icons — and that's just three questions.
item.content:encoded: This week, you'll need to be knowledgeable about holy media darlings, portrait-making techniques, and beloved Canadian icons — and that's just three questions.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: From the U.S. fate to the group of death, here are 5 takeaways from the World Cup draw
item.description: FIFA held a draw to determine who all 48 participating countries in the FIFA World Cup 2026 will face in the group phase of the tournament, which the U.S., Canada and Mexico are co-hosting.
item.content:encoded:
FIFA held a draw to determine who all 48 participating countries in the FIFA World Cup 2026 will face in the group phase of the tournament, which the U.S., Canada and Mexico are co-hosting.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Rafael Nam

item.title: Traffic congestion hits a record high, spreading to more hours of the week
item.description: If it seems like traffic is getting worse where you live, that's because it probably is. After dropping during the COVID-19 pandemic, congestion climbed to record levels in 2024, researchers say.
item.content:encoded:
If it seems like traffic is getting worse where you live, that's because it probably is. After dropping during the COVID-19 pandemic, congestion climbed to record levels in 2024, researchers say.

(Image credit: Patrick T. Fallon)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Hegseth under fire amid new Signalgate report and boat strike briefing, the FBI arrests man they say planted pipe bombs near the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, SCOTUS allows Texas to use gerrymandered map.
item.content:encoded: Hegseth under fire amid new Signalgate report and boat strike briefing, the FBI arrests man they say planted pipe bombs near the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, SCOTUS allows Texas to use gerrymandered map.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: After attack on two West Virginia Guard troops, their hometowns question deployments
item.description: After two West Virginia National Guard members were attacked while serving in D.C., some residents in the state are questioning President Trump's decision about deploying federal troops.
item.content:encoded: After two West Virginia National Guard members were attacked while serving in D.C., some residents in the state are questioning President Trump's decision about deploying federal troops.
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman
